thread.title: Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger admits Olivier Giroud shouldn't have celebrated equaliser at Bournemouth
thread.title_full: Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger admits Olivier Giroud shouldn't have celebrated equaliser at Bournemouth

author: Liam Corless
title: Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger admits Olivier Giroud shouldn't have celebrated equaliser at Bournemouth
text:
Sport Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger admits Olivier Giroud shouldn't have celebrated equaliser at Bournemouth Giroud has come in for criticism for the way he reacted to his equalising goal against Bournemouth on Tuesday night Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Arsene Wenger has his say on Giroud celebration Share this video Get Arsenal FC   
Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger has admitted Olivier Giroud shouldn't have celebrated his equaliser against Bournemouth in the manner that he did. 
The French striker has come in for criticism for the enthusiastic way he reacted to his 92nd-minute goal after the Gunners came from 3-0 down to salvage a point at the Vitality Stadium. 
While Giroud and teammate Gabriel were celebrating with travelling supporters, the majority of Arsenal's players were desperate to get the game restarted and search for a winner. 
As it was, Arsenal had to settle for a point, which was largely earned by Giroud, whose two assists and equalising goal made the comeback possible. Read More Giroud scored Arsenal's equaliser against Bournemouth... (Photo: Stuart MacFarlane) ... but has come in for criticism for the way he celebrated the goal (Photo: Stuart MacFarlane) 
Wenger confessed he could understand why the striker wanted to celebrate, but said his focus should've been on attempting to win the match. 
"Yes, of course (I would've preferred for him to get the game restarted). Of course," Wenger said on Thursday morning. 
"I understand both because at 3-0 down in the head of the players the game is lost, but ideally you want the guys to take the ball and put it in the middle of the pitch." 
Arsenal are currently eight points adrift of Premier League leaders Chelsea after the Blues were beaten 2-0 by Tottenham on Wednesday night. poll loading Was Giroud wrong to celebrate against Bournemouth? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
